block.p: Whitney Betts Wood, the daughter of Katharine Pillsbury Jose of Chestnut Hill, Mass., and W. Godfrey Wood of Falmouth, Me., was married yesterday to Eric Moore Bylin, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Moore Bylin of Princeton, N.J. The Rev. Thomas B. Kennedy, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the Congregational Church of South Dartmouth in Padanaram, Mass.
The couple graduated from Brown University.

Whitney Betts Wood, the daughter of Katharine Pillsbury Jose of Chestnut Hill, Mass., and W. Godfrey Wood of Falmouth, Me., was married yesterday to Eric Moore Bylin, a son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Moore Bylin of Princeton, N.J. The Rev. Thomas B. Kennedy, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at the Congregational Church of South Dartmouth in Padanaram, Mass.
The couple graduated from Brown University.

Ms. Wood, 27, is keeping her name. She produces documentary films for Engel Brothers Media in New York. She is currently an associate producer of ''Going Places,'' a series about travel broadcast on PBS.

The bride's father is the president of Penguins Attractions, a sports merchandising and holding company in Falmouth that is affiliated with the Pittsburgh Penguins hockey team. Her mother is the director of special gifts at the Noble and Greenough School in Dedham, Mass. The bride is a granddaughter of Sidney B. Wood Jr., who won the Wimbledon tennis championship in 1931, and a descendant of Charles A. Pillsbury, the founder of the Pillsbury Company.
Mr. Bylin, 30, is a vice president at Rockwood Realty in New York. He received an M.B.A. from Columbia University. His father is the president of Gift Holdings, a holding company in Princeton.
